Description: Fragment of a seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows darker discolouration and a partly glossy surface. The rear shows a concave area with the impression of wood, probably from a bolt or a box knob, perpendicular to this one deep impression of a turned cord with a width of 0.2 cm. The front side is flat and shows an oval scarab-like seal-impression with a circumferential line, the right half of the seal is preserved. Visible is a standing falcon-headed god with a sun disc, facing to the left, holding a wAs-sceptre in front of his body. Underneath a nb-basket.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
